column4: does anyone here know if the global app menu is here to stay?  I really think it makes using ubuntu a horrible experience, and using the 'hacks' to disable it all leave much to be desired.

for that matter, does anyone know if ALL of the 'OSX-esque' directions of ubuntu's design are here to stay, or are they a termporary thing?  Where can I voice my opinion in a constructive manner on the topic?
my desktop looks nothing like OSX
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/8850924/Desktop.png
looks like OSX?
looks more like Win7 if you ask me
it's LXDE...
you are talking about Unity, which is one part of the whole OS, you could use KDE and get a similar desktop to mine too
it can and you would replace openbox with compiz. You can replace any WM with compiz
understood, but as far as I've been able to figure out, only unity keeps the compiz settings I've grown dependent on
in brief, your view of the whole OS is based on one vERY CHANGABLE factor of it
the whole 'i hate unity' thing has been goingon for months now, haven't you see the web pages on it. Its boring now
it can be changed, its very simple
I suggest you install xfce4 and use that, it feels and runs like Gnome2 and you can run youor gnome apps there with no issue
you don't HAVE to use Unity
You're beating a dead horse - I know I don't have to use unity - I want to help shape unity's direction.
then report bugs and suggest features...
Is installing LXDE as easy as installing a few packages?  Will is potentially harm any other packages?
sudo apt-get install lxde
it won't harm any other packages at all...
if you want the look mine has, install lubuntu-desktop instead   and you will get a different default theme than normal, the lubuntu one, which is what I have
